item.name: Register

request.description:
This API endpoint allows you to register a new user account. It is an HTTP POST request that should be sent to the URL `https://127.0.0.1:3000/register`.

### Request Parameters

The request does not require any specific parameters. However, you may need to include the necessary user information such as email, and password in the request body.

### Response

If the registration is successful, the API will respond with a JSON object containing a message indicating that the user account has been created. The message will also instruct the user to verify their account through the email that has been sent to them.

Here is an example response:

``` json
{
    "message": "User account succesfully created, please verify your account through the email we sent"
}

 ```

Please note that the response may vary depending on the specific implementation of the API.

response.name: Succesful Register
FAIL User already exists
FAIL Invalid Email
FAIL Invalid Password

request.description:
This API endpoint is used to verify a user account by providing a verification token in the request URL. The verification token is a JSON Web Token (JWT) that is generated when a user signs up.

To verify an account, an email will be set to the user with the following link which they can click on:

```
https://127.0.0.1:3000/verification/?verification_token={JWT-Token}

 ```

Replace `{JWT-Token}` with the actual verification token received by the user.

### Response

The response for this request will include a message indicating whether the account was verified successfully or not. An example of a successful response is:

``` json
{
    "message" : "Account verified successfully!"
}

 ```

Please note that the response may vary depending on the implementation of the API.

response.name: Successful Email Verification

query.description: Unique token with 30 min expiery and stored in data base.

response.name: Invalid Email Verification

query.description: Unique token with 30 min expiery and stored in data base.

response.name: FAIL JWT malformed

item.description: Request to register and their input and possible outputs

request.description:
This API endpoint is used to authenticate a user and obtain a JWT token for subsequent requests.

To authenticate, send a POST request to `https://127.0.0.1:3000/login`.

The request should include the necessary credentials in the body of the request.

Upon successful authentication, the server will respond with a JSON object containing the JWT token.

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "token": "JWT token"
}

 ```

Please note that the actual response may contain additional properties not mentioned here.

Make sure to include the obtained JWT token in the headers of subsequent requests that require authentication.

response.name: Login Successful
FAIL Email is not registered
FAIL Invalid Email
FAIL Invalid Password
FAIL Invalid User Credentials
FAIL Too Many Login Attempt Notifier
FAIL Blocked Account
FAIL Not verified account

request.description:
This API endpoint is used to authenticate a user and obtain a JWT token for subsequent requests.

To authenticate, send a POST request to `https://127.0.0.1:3000/login`.

The request should include the necessary credentials in the body of the request.

Upon successful authentication, the server will respond with a JSON object containing the JWT token.

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "token": "JWT token"
}

 ```

Please note that the actual response may contain additional properties not mentioned here.

Make sure to include the obtained JWT token in the headers of subsequent requests that require authentication.

This endpoint is used to send a reset password email to the user. It is an HTTP POST request that should be sent to [https://127.0.0.1:3000/reset-password](https://127.0.0.1:3000/reset-password).

### Request Parameters

This request does not require any request parameters but it requires the request body to contain an email

### Response

Upon successful execution of the request, the server will respond with a JSON object containing a message indicating that the link to reset the email has been sent. Here is an example response:

``` json
{
    "message" : "Link to reset email has been sent"
}

 ```

Please note that the actual content of the reset email will not be included in the response.

response.name: Successful Request
FAIL Invalid Email
Fail User Not Registered

request.description:
This endpoint is used to send a reset password email to the user. It is an HTTP POST request that should be sent to [https://127.0.0.1:3000/reset-password](https://127.0.0.1:3000/reset-password).

### Request Parameters

This request does not require any request parameters but it requires the request body to contain an email

### Response

Upon successful execution of the request, the server will respond with a JSON object containing a message indicating that the link to reset the email has been sent. Here is an example response:

``` json
{
    "message" : "Link to reset email has been sent"
}

 ```

Please note that the actual content of the reset email will not be included in the response.

response.name: Successfull Request
